Work, Power & Energy.docstring:
Calculates the work done by a constant force, given the force, displacement, and the angle between them (W = F · S).

Parameters:
    force_magnitude (float): The magnitude of the constant force in Newtons (N).
    displacement_magnitude (float): The magnitude of the displacement in meters (m).
    angle_degrees (float): The angle between the force and displacement vectors in degrees.

Returns:
    float: The work done in Joules (J).

Calculates the total or net work done on an object by summing the work done by individual forces.

Parameters:
    work_list (list[float]): A list of work values (W1, W2, ...) in Joules (J).

Returns:
    float: The total work done in Joules (J).
Work, Power & Energy.python_code:
def calculate_total_work_from_list(work_list: list[float]) -> float:
    return sum(work_list)

Work, Power & Energy.docstring:
Calculates the kinetic energy (K) of an object given its linear momentum (P) and mass (m).

Parameters:
    momentum (float): The linear momentum of the object in kilogram-meters per second (kg·m/s).
    mass (float): The mass of the object in kilograms (kg).

Returns:
    float: The kinetic energy in Joules (J).

Calculates the magnitude of the linear momentum (P) of an object given its kinetic energy (K) and mass (m).

Parameters:
    kinetic_energy (float): The kinetic energy of the object in Joules (J).
    mass (float): The mass of the object in kilograms (kg).

Returns:
    float: The magnitude of the linear momentum in kilogram-meters per second (kg·m/s).

Calculates the change in potential energy (ΔU) based on the work (W) done by a conservative force.

Parameters:
    work_by_conservative_force (float): The work done by the conservative force in Joules (J).

Returns:
    float: The change in potential energy (U2 - U1) in Joules (J).

Calculates the change in kinetic energy (ΔK) of a system using the Work-Energy Theorem.

Parameters:
    work_conservative (float): Work done by conservative forces in Joules (J).
    work_non_conservative (float): Work done by non-conservative forces in Joules (J).
    work_pseudo_force (float): Work done by pseudo-forces in Joules (J).

Returns:
    float: The change in kinetic energy (ΔK) in Joules (J).
Work, Power & Energy.python_code:
def calculate_change_in_kinetic_energy(work_conservative: float, work_non_conservative: float, work_pseudo_force: float) -> float:
    return work_conservative + work_non_conservative + work_pseudo_force

Work, Power & Energy.docstring:
Calculates the sum of work done by non-conservative (W_NC) and pseudo-forces (W_PS) using the modified work-energy theorem.

Parameters:
    delta_kinetic_energy (float): The change in kinetic energy (ΔK) in Joules (J).
    delta_potential_energy (float): The change in potential energy (ΔU) in Joules (J).

Returns:
    float: The sum of non-conservative and pseudo-force work (W_NC + W_PS) in Joules (J).
Work, Power & Energy.python_code:
def calculate_work_non_conservative_pseudo(delta_kinetic_energy: float, delta_potential_energy: float) -> float:
    return delta_kinetic_energy + delta_potential_energy

Work, Power & Energy.docstring:
Calculates the average power (P_avg) delivered by an agent.

Parameters:
    work (float): The total work done in Joules (J).
    time (float): The time interval over which the work was done in seconds (s).

Returns:
    float: The average power in Watts (W).

Calculates the instantaneous power (P) delivered by a force, given the force, velocity, and the angle between them (P = F · v).

Parameters:
    force_magnitude (float): The magnitude of the force in Newtons (N).
    velocity_magnitude (float): The magnitude of the velocity in meters per second (m/s).
    angle_degrees (float): The angle between the force and velocity vectors in degrees.

Returns:
    float: The instantaneous power in Watts (W).
